intro: Craspedia richea var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth craspedia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It features small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. The variety 'glabrata' is distinguished by its smooth, hairless leaves, which set it apart from other varieties within the species.
